medical_history.chief_complaint: Resistance to thyroid hormone (RTH) associated with homozygous mutations in the THRB gene.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The condition was characterized by symptoms such as compromised intellectual development, tachycardia, goiter, growth retardation, and hearing loss evident from birth, with severity increasing over time. Clinical findings include high serum TSH levels, failure to thrive observed at 1 year and 8 months, and delays in verbal development and IQ scores declining through subsequent evaluations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Homozygous mutations in the THRB gene affecting thyroid hormone function. Family history of similar symptoms observed in relatives.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes relatives with thyroid dysfunction and hearing impairment, indicating possible hereditary patterns of thyroid hormone resistance.
